text:
She admitted that she still loves 'best friend' Tom Sturridge on speaking about their split for this first time, this week.
But Sienna Miller seemed content with flying solo on Wednesday night when she stepped out for the opening night of David Byrne's rock musical Joan Of Arc: Into The Fire on Wednesday night.
The actress, 35, a Broadway veteran herself, posed for photos as she arrived at The Public Theater on Lafayette Street.
Scroll down for video
VIP: Sienna Miller turned out to support the opening night of David Byrne's rock musical Joan Of Arc: Into The Fire on Broadway on Wednesday night
British beauty Miller parred down her look in pinstripe culottes with braces and a cream turtleneck sweater.
She added black bovver boots and wore her dark blonde hair loose with a center parting.
Miller kept her make-up light showing off her natural beauty with just a splash of cherry lip color.
All smiles: The pretty blonde actress, 35, was fresh-faced as she showed off her natural beauty with just a splash of red lip color
Just this month, covering Harper's Bazaar magazine, Sienna addressed her high profile split from fellow actor Tom for the first time.
'I think in a break-up somebody has to be a little bit cruel in order for it to be traditional,' she explained. 'But it's not been acrimonious in a way where you would choose to not be around that person.'
Sienna shares four-year-old daughter Marlowe with Tom but went on to clarify: 'We don't live together, as has been reported recently, but we do half the time.'
'It's great for our daughter that she has two parents who love each other and are friendsâ€¦ He's definitely my best friend in the entire world.'
Stylish: Miller wore baggy pinstripe culottes with braces and a cream turtleneck sweater
Funky: The Broadway veteran completed her look with black tights and black bovver boots
Also taking in the first night performance on Wednesday, was Vogue's Editor In Chief Anna Wintour.
She wore her trademark bob and dark glasses with a plush coat over a long black dress with a colorful pattern down the front.
Posing for photos, too, was Jo Lampert, who plays the titular role of Joan Of Arc in the musical.
